questions: Q.1. What does the term ‘Drainage’ mean?
answers: Ans. The term ‘drainage’ describes the river system of an area.

questions: Q.2. What is a ‘drainage basin’?
answers: Ans. The area drained by a single river system is called a drainage basin.

questions: Q.3. Which part of the land is called ‘water divide’?
answers: Ans. Any elevated area, such as a mountain or an upland separates two drainage basins. Such an upland is known as a ‘water divide’.

questions: Q.4. Into which two major groups are Indian rivers divided?
answers: Ans. The Indian rivers are divided into two major groups (i) The Himalayan Rivers (ii) The Peninsular Rivers

questions: Q.5. Which rivers are called perennial?
answers: Ans. Perennial rivers are the ones which have water throughout the year. These rivers receive water from rain as well as from melted snow from the lofty mountains.

questions: Q.6. Which river has the largest basin in India?
answers: Ans. River Ganga

questions: Q.7. Why are Peninsular rivers called seasonal?
answers: Ans. A large number of peninsular rivers are seasonal as their flow is dependent on rainfall and even the large rivers have reduced flow of water in the dry season.

questions: Q.8. Name the rivers which originate in Central Highlands & flow towards the west.
answers: Ans. Rivers Narmada and Tapi.

questions: Q.9. What is a river system?
answers: Ans. A river along with its tributaries may be called a river system.

questions: Q.10. From where does river Indus originate?
answers: Ans. River Indus originates in Tibet, near Lake Mansarowar.

questions: Q.11. Which are the main tributaries of river Indus?
answers: Ans. The Satluj, the Beas, the Ravi, the Chenab and the Jhelum are the main tributaries of river Indus.

questions: Q.12. Name the main tributaries of the river Ganga.
answers: Ans. The Yamuna, the Ghaghara, the Gandak and the Kosi are the main tributaries of river Ganga.

questions: Q.13. How is Sunderban Delta named?
answers: Ans. The Sunderban delta has derived its name from Sundari trees which grow well in marshland.

questions: Q.14. By what name is Brahmaputra known in Tibet and Bangladesh?
answers: Ans. In Tibet it is known as Tsang-Po and in Bangladesh it is called Jamuna.

questions: Q.15. Why does river Brahmaputra carry less water in Tibet?
answers: Ans. In Tibet, the river carries a smaller volume of water & less silt as it is a cold and a dry area.

questions: Q.16. Name the major Peninsular rivers.
answers: Ans. The Mahanadi, the Godavari, the Krishna and the Kaveri.

questions: Q.17. Which two peninsular rivers form estuaries?
answers: Ans. Narmada and Tapi.

questions: Q.18. Which are the main west flowing rivers of Western Ghats?
answers: Ans. Sabarmati, Mahi, Bharatpuja and Periyar.

questions: Q.19. Which river is the largest Peninsular river?
answers: Ans. The Godavari, its length is about 1500 km.

questions: Q.20. Which river is called ‘Dakshin Ganga’?
answers: Ans. Godavari is called ‘Dakshin Ganga’ because of its length and the area it covers.

questions: Q.21. What is ‘Shivasamudram’?
answers: Ans. The river Kaveri makes the second biggest waterfall in India.

questions: Q.22. Name some of the freshwater lakes of India.
answers: Ans. The Wular lake, The Dal lake, Bhimtal, Nainital, Loktak and Barapani.
